resources.string:
Drag with two fingers to move the plan without changing what is selected.
Double tap on any object to edit it.
Two demo home files will be in your downloads folder, use Open... in the menu.
You can use your browser to directly open more home files (.sh3d) from the internet, for example http://www.sweethome3d.com/gallery.

Hold down on any item to add it to the plan, it will be selected and at location 0,0.
From this view you can import furniture catalog libraries using the actions.

This is a view of all the furniture currently placed on your plan.
From here you can change the visibility of items.

If you are looking from the top down, pinch will move the camera closer to the center or further from it.
If you are looking from the visit point of view, pinch will move you forward or backward.
Save the camera position with the add camera icon, go to a camera position with the switch camera icon.
Changing from top down to visit can be done by the icon of a plan/person.

This home is %1 in size, this size may be too large to be smoothly edited in Renovations 3D, would you like to start with the viewable setting for non-selected levels off? (Recommended)
To view those levels you will need to double tap the level name and tick on the Viewable option, note that it is advisable to keep the number of viewable levels to a minimum for large homes like this.
High quality photo rendering can take a long time to calculate, in some cases more than an hour, please be aware of this.
This library file is now being downloaded, this may take some time, you will be notified once it is downloaded and installed.
This library exists in your downloads, you can import it using the Local option.
Please select sh3t file to import
Please select sh3f file to import
You are being directed to the Sweet Home 3D desktop application\'s help system, it will not match exactly with Renovations 3D user interface.
This device currently has insufficient resources to do 3D rendering, please consider restarting.
For mistakes use Undo. Drag the plan around with one finger, zoom by using the pinch action. Try moving the plan now... (You can close/show this tutorial anytime.)
Select the \"Create walls\" tool from the Tool Selector.
Create a wall by dragging on the screen and then lifting your finger.
Create a square of walls by dragging three more times. Make the last drag end near the start of your first wall.
Join the last wall to the first by double tapping to finish creation.
Select the \"Create Rooms\" tool from the Tool Selector.
Double tap anywhere inside the four walls to create a room.
Edit the new room by double tapping on it, select the floor texture, make it tiled. Close the dialogs.
Show the furniture catalog, by pressing the arrow.
Long press on a chair, and it will be added to your plan.
Move the chair around, and try rotating it.
Tap the 3D button, and the view will change to the 3D view.
Move the camera around by dragging.
Go inside the home by pressing the virtual visit button.
Show the furniture catalog, by dragging it out from the left side of the screen.
Long press on a door, and it will be added to your plan.
Drag the door onto a wall, notice that it automatically fits itself to the wall.
Good work, now you could go look at your door in 3d? Or give the walls some color? Later you could see if you work out how to make a photo of your home...
